html: Characterizing the return journey of Jehovah’s people to Zion are the enduring blessings of joy and peace that both attest to Jehovah’s handiwork (Isaiah 9:3; 26:12, 19; 51:3, 11; 53:5) and typify the fruits of his people’s righteousness (Isaiah 26:2-3; 57:1-2; 61:7-11; 65:13-18). Like the rainbow after the Flood (Genesis 9:12-17), Jehovah’s everlasting “sign” and “testimony” are the regenerating wilderness that accompanies his people’s return (Isaiah 35:1-10; 41:17-20; 43:19-21; 51:1-3) as Jehovah and his servant personally lead them home (Isaiah 52:11-12; 58:8; cf. 48:20-21; 49:8-13).
